awards.description: PROJECT TITLE: BUILDING CAPACITY WITH A PHASED APPROACH TO CLIMATE CHANGE RESILIENCE

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES ASSISTANCE TO AN ELIGIBLE RECIPIENT TO BUILD CAPACITY TO ADMINISTER ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS ON INDIAN LANDS.  ALL ADMINISTRATIVE AND PROGRAMMATIC TERMS AND CONDITIONS ARE UPDATED. THE UPDATED CONDITIONS DO NOT APPLY RETROACTIVELY TO FUNDS ALREADY EXPENDEDAND THEY APPLY ONLY TO UNEXPENDED FUNDS AND THE NEW MONIES ADDED TO THE AGREEMENT.  SPECIFICALLY, THE KETCHIKAN INDIAN COMMUNITY WILL USE THESE FUNDS FOR BUILDING TRIBAL CAPACITY TO DEVELOP ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS. THIS MULTIYEAR WORKPLAN WILL INCREASE TRIBAL ABILITY TO MANAGE FEDERAL ENVIRONMENTAL FUNDSAND GATHER BASELINE WATER QUALITY DATAAND BEGIN THE PROCESS TO UPDATE THE TRIBE&RSQUOANDS ETEPAND INCREASE TRIBAL ENGAGEMENT IN THE STATE AND FEDERAL REGULATORY PROCESSESAND BEGIN TO PLAN TO ADAPT TO CLIMATE CHANGE AND DEVELOP A TRIBAL COMMUNICATION PLAN ON ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES.

DESCRIPTION:THE KETCHIKAN INDIAN COMMUNITY WILL CONTINUE BUILDING TRIBAL CAPACITY TO DEVELOP ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS AND INCREASE ABILITY TO MANAGE FEDERAL ENVIRONMENTAL FUNDS.  KETCHIKAN INDIAN COMMUNITY WILL GATHER BASELINE WATER QUALITY DATA ON LOCAL WATERSHEDS; INCREASE TRIBAL ENGAGEMENT IN THE LOCAL SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS; AND DEVELOP A TRIBAL COMMUNICATION PLAN ON ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE ENGAGEMENT WITH ENVIRONMENTAL REGULATORY ISSUES RELEVANT TO ENVIRONMENTAL THREATS FACED BY THE KETCHIKAN TRIBAL COMMUNITY, PREPAREDNESS OF THE KETCHIKAN TRIBAL COMMUNITY FOR ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS, BASELINE MONITORING STRATEGIES OF LOCAL WATERSHEDS TO GAIN VALUABLE INSIGHTS INTO THE WATERWAYS AND IMPROVE TRIBAL CAPACITY TO OBTAIN AND MANAGE GRANTS WELL.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE QUARTERLY PROGRESS REPORTS, TRIP REPORTS, MEETING NOTES, NEWSLETTERS, PRESENTATIONS, AND PHOTOS. EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE SUSTAINABLE MANAGEMENT OF SOLID AND HAZARDOUS WASTE, TRAINED STAFF TO MAINTAIN AN EFFECTIVE ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM, AND INCREASE CAPACITY TO RESPOND TO COMMUNITY ENVIRONMENTAL CONCERNS. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS GRANT ARE MEMBERS OF THE TRIBE.

PROJECT TITLE: KETCHIKAN INDIAN COMMUNITY TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM FUNDING FY 2024 :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: ALL TRANSPORTATION FUNDING PROVIDED BY FHWA TO KETCHIKAN INDIAN COMMUNITY UNDER THE FHWA OTT PROGRAM AGREEMENT FOR FY24
